So in code:

integer, dimension(0:255) :: counts = 0

integer :: i, c

character(len=20) :: s

logical :: ok

ok = .true.

! Initialize counts to zero

counts = 0

do i = 1, len_trim(s)

   c = ichar(s(i:i))

   counts(c) = counts(c) +1

end do

! Now check the counts

integer :: num_distinct = 0

do i = 0, 255

   if (counts(i) >0) then

      num_distinct = num_distinct +1

      if (counts(i) /=2) then

         ok = .false.

      end if

   end if

end do

if (num_distinct /=2 .or. .not. ok) then

   print *, "No"

else

   print *, "Yes"

end if

Test case 3:

First program outputs "1122 3344" → s is "1122".

Processing s: characters '1','1','2','2'. counts for '1' is 2, '2' is 2. num_distinct is 2 → output "Yes".

Another test case where first program outputs "12 34" → s is "12".

Characters '1' and '2' each once → counts are 1 each. So num_distinct is 2 but counts not 2 → output "No".

Another case where first program outputs "11 22" → s is "11".

Characters '1' twice → counts for '1' is 2. num_distinct is 1 → output "No".

Another case where first program outputs "1212 34" → s is "1212".

Characters '1' and '2' each two times → counts are 2 each. num_distinct is 2 → output "Yes".

So the code should handle these cases.

Now, writing the Fortran code.

But in Fortran, variables must be declared before use. So the code structure would be:

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, m, a, b

   logical :: is_impossible, is_zero_zero

   character(len=20) :: s, a_str

   integer, dimension(0:255) :: counts

   logical :: ok

   integer :: i, c, num_distinct

   ! Read input

   read*, n, m

   ! Compute first part

   is_impossible = .false.

   is_zero_zero = .false.

   if (n ==0) then

      if (m /=0) then

         is_impossible = .true.

      else

         is_zero_zero = .true.

      end if

   else

      if (m <=n) then

         if (m ==0) then

            m =1

         end if

         a = n

         b = m +n -1

      else

         a = m

         b = m +n -1

      end if

   end if

   ! Construct s

   if (is_impossible) then

      s = "Impossible"

   else if (is_zero_zero) then

      s = "0"

   else

      write(a_str, '(i0)') a

      s = trim(adjustl(a_str))

   end if

   ! Process second part

   counts = 0

   ok = .true.

   do i =1, len_trim(s)

      c = ichar(s(i:i))

      counts(c) = counts(c) +1

   end do

   num_distinct =0

   do i=0,255

      if (counts(i) >0) then

         num_distinct = num_distinct +1

         if (counts(i) /=2) then

            ok = .false.

         end if

      end if

   end do

   if (num_distinct ==2 .and. ok) then

      print *, "Yes"

   else

      print *, "No"

   end if

end program main
